meanings.sent1: She spoke prolixly, making the meeting last much longer than necessary.
meanings.sent2: He prolixly explained the rules of the game, causing everyone to lose interest.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prolixly described the assignment, putting the students to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her story meandered prolixly, like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The politician rambled prolixly, trying to avoid answering the question directly.

meanings.definition: Using an excessive amount of words.
meanings.sent1: His prolixly written report was difficult to read due to its unnecessary length.
meanings.sent2: The prolixly written speech bored the audience with its endless verbosity.
meanings.sent3: The prolixly worded advertisement confused customers with its wordiness.
meanings.sent4: Her prolixly detailed explanation left no room for questions.
meanings.sent5: The prolixly written novel seemed to never reach its conclusion.
